availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward L. Bradley (Hopkins Co., Ky, merchant's clerk, merchant and farm laborer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, merchant, clerk and farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of William Bradley and Catherine M. Bradley. Merchant and merchant's clerk in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Household owned forty-three enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 50B, 112A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 704.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 736.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 215B-216A.
"Edward L. Bradley (1829-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #62716463, accessed October 27, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62716463.
